alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jewell, Smith, Clay, Nuckolls, eastern Webster, eastern Adams, Fillmore and Thayer Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1109 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Harvard to near Deweese to 6 miles south of Bostwick to near Portis. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Clay Center, Edgar, Nelson and Nora around 1115 PM CDT. Superior, Oak, Saronville, Webber and Lovewell State Park around 1120 PM CDT. Sutton, Davenport and Hardy around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Deshler, Grafton, Carleton, Byron, Geneva, Hebron, Fairmont, Bruning, Belvidere, Exeter, Milligan, Alexandria and Gilead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
